intro: Metastelma suberosum, commonly known as the hairy stemmed metaphytes, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its woody, cylindrical stem covered in a dense layer of brown, scaly bark. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish-white flowers, which are often pollinated by insects. Its leaves are long, narrow, and often have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in its native habitat. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
